Boston.com
10

Menino stays hospitalized to get more tests on back

Boston Mayor Thomas M. Menino has been at Brigham and Women's Hospital for three weeks with a variety of ailments, including intense back pain. (Globe, 5:52 p.m.)

Ameridose to be closed until 2013

The sister drug company of the Framingham pharmacy that is at the root of a national meningitis outbreak will stay shut at least through December. (Globe, 6:05 p.m.)

RMV worker accused of taking bribes

Adriana Ferreira, a naturalized US citizen, is accused of collecting cash bribes in return for falsely promising to provide illegal immigrants with Mass. driver's licenses, officials said. (Globe, 3:06 p.m.)

Obama, GOP leaders confident after meeting on approaching `fiscal cliff'

Congressional leaders declared confidence today that they could reach a deal with President Obama to avert tax hikes and budget cuts at year’s end. (Globe, 3:56 p.m.)

Opinion | Brian McGrory

Perpetual politics
in Massachusetts

Get ready for two solid years of nonstop bickering, ominous commercials, over-programmed candidates, and dinnertime robo-calls.

Regulators are moving to strengthen oversight of compounding pharmacies like the one in Framingham blamed for a deadly meningitis outbreak.
Opinion | Scot Lehigh

Enough supply-side silliness

The GOP needs to move away from “dumbed-down conservatism.” It also needs to rethink supply-side economics, its doctrine since the Reagan era.

News

Gulf rig fire leaves 4 hurt, 2 missing

An explosion and fire ripped through a Gulf oil platform Friday as workers used a cutting torch, sending four people to a hospital and leaving two missing in waters off Louisiana. The well was not producing at the time and no oil was leaking.

Global warming talk heats up, revisits carbon tax

Climate change is suddenly a hot topic again. The Congressional Budget Office issued a 19-page report on the ways to make a carbon tax less burdensome on lower income people.

Business

American City Business Journals buys Boston’s Streetwise Media

The owner of the Boston Business Journal has acquired the local online news start-up Streetwise Media Inc., which is best known for its website Bostinno.com that covers the area’s growing technology sector.
